intro: Anthocleista orientalis, commonly known as the oriental arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. It is valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its ornamental value also makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in suitable climates.
